description: The hardy pecan (Carya illinoinensis 'Montgomery') is an amazing tree species and is touted as one of the hardiest of the pecan species. Its dense and strong wood make it highly resistant to high winds and drought, while its long-term fruit production ability and adaptability make it well-suited to commercial or urban landscapes. Its edible nuts are large and sweet, making it great for both snacking and baking. The tree is often grown as an ornamental species, as its shiny leaves and attractive bark add beauty to any garden. Whether grown for its nuts or its ornamental value, the hardy pecan is a great choice for any landscape.
